meanings.sent1: She couldn't stop laughing at his funny gags.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's gags had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent3: The gags shared by the friends made the party even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His gags were like little bursts of joy in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The gags he told were so clever that everyone remembered them for days.

meanings.definition: A device used to prevent someone from speaking.
meanings.sent1: The kidnapper used a gag to keep the victim silent.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to speak with the gag in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The bright-colored gag made the situation seem less serious.
meanings.sent4: The gag felt like a barrier between her and the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The tight gag made it hard for her to make any sound.

meanings.sent1: The spicy food made him gag uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: She gagged on the foul smell coming from the garbage.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected taste of the dish caused her to gag in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The thick smoke in the room made him gag and cough.
meanings.sent5: The pungent odor of the chemicals made her gag instantly.
